title: Compostable compositions, articles and methods of making compostable articles

events.title: Application filed by 3M Innovative Properties Co

abstract: The present application relates to compostable articles and compositions including at least one biodegradable polymer and a hydrophobic agent. In some embodiments, the compostable articles and compositions include a second biodegradable polymer, different from the first biodegradable polymer. In some embodiments, the first biodegradable polymer is selected from the group consisting of poly(ethylene succinate) (PES), poly(trimethylene succinate) (PTS), poly(butylene succinate) (PBS), poly(butylene succinate co-butylene adipate) (PBSA), poly (butylene adipate co-terephthalate) (PBAT), poly(tetramethylene adipate-co-terephthalate) (PTAT), and thermoplastic starch. In some embodiments, the presently described articles include packaging.
claims:
1. A packaging article comprising
a first wall having a first interior surface and a first exterior surface opposite the first interior surface; a second wall having a second interior surface and a second exterior surface opposite the second interior surface, the first and second interior surfaces defining an interior of the packaging article and the first and second exterior surfaces defining an exterior of the packaging article; and one or more edges where the first wall is attached to the second wall; wherein the first wall or the second wall comprises a compostable composition comprising:
a first biodegradable polymer selected from the group consisting of poly(ethylene succinate) (PES), poly(trimethylene succinate) (PTS), poly(butylene succinate) (PBS), poly(butylene succinate co-butylene adipate) (PBSA), poly (butylene adipate coterephthalate) (PBAT), poly(tetramethylene adipate-co-terephthalate) (PTAT);
thermoplastic starch; and
a hydrophobic agent.
2. The packaging article of claim 1, wherein the article is one of a pouch, a bag, or an envelope.
3. The packaging article of claim 1, wherein the compostable composition is a heatsealable compostable coating.

4. The packaging article of claim 3, wherein the compostable heat-sealable coating comprises one or more of polybutylene succinate, poly (butylene succinate adipate), poly(ethylene succinate), poly(tetramethylene adipate-co-terephthalate), or thermoplastic starch.
5. The packaging article of claim 3, wherein at least one of the first wall or the second wall comprises a polylactide coated with the heat-sealable coating.
6. The packaging article of claim 1, wherein at least one of the first wall and the second wall comprises one of a nonwoven or cellulose.

7. The packaging article of claim 1, wherein the first wall and the second wall comprise:
an inner layer having a first major surface and opposing second major surface; and an outer layer having a third major surface and opposing fourth major surface; wherein the first major surface of the inner layer is the first interior surface, the second interior surface, or both and the fourth major surface of the outer layer is the first exterior surface, the second exterior surface, or both.
8. The packaging article of claim 7, further comprising an intermediate layer between the inner layer and the outer layer.
9. The packaging article of claim 1, wherein the first wall, the second wall, or both the first wall and the second wall are embossed in a repeating pattern.
10. The packaging article of claim 8, wherein the inner layer is embossed in a repeating pattern.
11. The packaging article of claim 1, wherein at least an adhesive portion is disposed on the second exterior surface and over any coating on the second exterior surface.
12. The packaging article of claim 11, wherein the adhesive portion or portions consist of a compostable adhesive.

13. The packaging article of claim 12, wherein the compostable adhesive comprises one or more of: a copolymer of 2-octylacrylate and acrylic acid, a copolymer of sugar-modified acrylates, a blend of polylactic acid and polycaprolactone, poly(hydroxyalkanoate), protein adhesive, natural rubber adhesive, and dimer acid containing polyamides.

14. The packaging article of claim 1, wherein the first wall further comprises a flap that is adapted to be folded between an open configuration and a closed configuration, and that extends beyond the opening of the packaging article in the open configuration and covers the opening in the packaging article in the closed configuration.
15. An assembly comprising the packaging article of claim 1 and an object located within the interior of the packaging article.

16. A method of making a packaging article of claim 1, comprising
folding a first compostable sheet having a heat sealable compostable coating to form a folded sheet, wherein a portion of the folded sheet on one side of the fold constitutes the first wall the a with one edge defined by a fold; and sealing at least one additional edge to form the packaging article.
